content:
What is the exact error message. Verbatim please.

Despite all that information you supplied about the inconvenience to you and the possible impacts going forward, you glossed over the actual error message the product is giving you. That error message is the only clue anyone on the other end of an internet connection gets to try and determine what has happened and what the appropriate fix might be.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Sorting is done by clicking on the headings in the message list or, in list or cards view, you can use the film strip looking icon and select sort by from the menu.

If you can make your way to the unified options, you can also find the all folders view.

Note that multiple "view types" can be active at the time time and appear in the folder view one after the other.
creator: MattAuSupport

Would it break your keyboard to say for example click on quick filter and then there beside that box if you click on the squiggly lines you will see the box with the table view and card view? content: Your operating system must think you do as that show button uses the password verify dialog from the operating system to verify you are at least knowing your own access password for the local machine.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Entering that password should bring up another page requesting various permissions for Thunderbird. It is a flow of pages, not a single password page. The failure to connect can occasionally appear before the flow is complete, but still complete it.

Note that Microsoft only allows a limited time to actually respond as well, so if you leave the page hang there for 5 minutes it will abort because it has timed out.
creator: MattAuSupport

[This, without further permissions requests.] Do you have any thoughts on this, please? Many thanks again, Barry.
